color_neighbors.prompt: if the upper left neighbor of p exist, turn it to green, if the upper right neighbor of p exist, turn it to pink, if the bottom left neighbor of p exist, turn it to teal, if the bottom right neighbor of p exist, turn it to orange, return the grid

turn_red_pixel_to_black.code:
def turn_red_pixel_to_black(input_grid: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    """
    Given an input grid, this function finds the first red pixel and turns it into black. 
    Then, it colors the neighboring pixels of the red pixel with specific colors and returns the updated grid.
    
    Args:
    input_grid: A numpy array representing the input grid.
    
    Returns:
    A numpy array representing the updated grid.
    """
    p = "find the red pixel"(input_grid)
    input_grid[p[0]][p[1]] = black
    color = "if the upper left neighbor of p exist, turn it to green, if the upper right neighbor of p exist, turn it to pink, if the bottom left neighbor of p exist, turn it to teal, if the bottom right neighbor of p exist, turn it to orange, return the grid"(p, input_grid)
    return color

main.code:
def main(input_grid: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    p = "find the red pixel"(input_grid)
    color = "if the upper left neighbor of p exist, turn it to green, if the upper right neighbor of p exist, turn it to pink, if the bottom left neighbor of p exist, turn it to teal, if the bottom right neighbor of p exist, turn it to orange, return the grid"(p, input_grid)
    out = "turn red pixel into black."(color)
    return out
